Message.Title: PC sales drop 11% in second quarter
Message.Msg: Shipments dropped to 76m units, a nearly 11 per cent decline for the second quarter compared to last year, as consumers turned to inexpensive tablets over desktop or laptop computers, especially in new markets, according to a report released on Wednesday by Gartner, the research company.

Topic.Title: At a tiny 0.53%, Windoze 8 adoption levels in the enterprise are shockingly low

Message.Msg: This is very simple. The enterprise won't adopt it right away. There are many reasons. The .5 are mostly beta testers in the IT departments in their labs testing the software for compatibility issue and OS training. I am assuming that most will skip 8 altogether and go to 9, but that will depend on what is required on the back end/servers/software upgrades/etc. We are just getting rid of xp now and adopting 7. In 2018 we will be testing MS newest OS and adopting that. Mac and Linux aren't an option.

Message.Title: Jury Will Find Zimmerman Not Guilty in Less Than 4 Hours
Message.Msg: The trial resulting from The Arrest That Should Have Never Been is a tragedy for all involved. But, the only evidence presented by witnesses at trial was that Zimmerman broke off his trailing of Martin at the instruction of the 911 dispatcher, and was returning to his car when he was approached, pinned to the ground and beaten by Martin. The screams for help heard in the background of a neighbor's 911 call were identified as coming from Zimmerman, as Martin's father even initially said that it wasn't his son's voice. Upon this verdict, if there is any crime committed against Zimmerman, or he is injured or worse, felony charges need to be filed against Jesse Jackson and Al Sharpton for starting up and proliferating the national racial horseschitt where there was none. And all charges for damages and destruction caused due to the verdict should be assessed their personal assets, corporate interests, foundations, and organizations.

Message.Title: Ballmer Copies Apple Again
Message.Msg: This moron has never had an original thought in his entire life. From an article about MS' "massive restructuring": "Ballmer, who took over as CEO from co-founder Bill Gates in 2000, said he wants the company to be more like Apple Inc. The maker of the iPhone and iPad has roared past Microsoft in sales and stock market value in the past few years by smoothly melding its devices with online services such as iTunes." The reason Apple has kicked Microsoft's #$%$ isn#$%$ structure per se, but rather the talent of Apple's leaders, which far exceeds that of Microsoft "leaders". Fat Boy can restructure all he wants. As long as the same morons, including Ballmer, run the company, MS will not be able to compete with other tech companies. I predict that within the year, this restructuring will come to nothing, except, probably, a bunch more layoffs of innocent people at the lower levels.

Message.Title: MSFT problem - Ballmer
Message.Msg: Does everyone really believe that Ballmer can lead this company to great innovative consumer products that everyone wants? His track record, on all fronts, has been less than stellar. This restructuring is a smoke screen hiding the real problem...the supreme leader sees consumer demand as important as business/enterprise but is clueless about getting there as he lacks hipness or understanding of trends, fashion and the general pulse of a younger generation. I have owned this stock for more than a decade...Ballmer ascension and position has always been a problem for this company to move forward. Gates knew when he made enough $ and had lost his influence on the consumer. To be hip, you must also have some creds and influence in new design, fashion, taste. Being a conservative executive is not exactly what innovation is made of....insert Tim Cook reference here as well....The general culture OF LEADERSHIP at Microsoft appears to be a group of well intentioned, good hearted, intelligent people who THINK they know what is ground breaking, great, cool, hip, innovative....ask any artist or designer if this is how they really think...and you will find they do not think this way at all. MS is a company with a schizophrenic personality, the corporate business side controlling all of the power and money and the innovative side with little but their pride and desire to rethink their world. Who should really be controlling this company?

Message.Title: Steve Ballmer’s “One Microsoft,” Meet Steve Sinofsky’s “One Strategy”
Message.Msg: Google it. Quoting: ' “We are rallying behind a single strategy as one company — not a collection of divisional strategies,” said Ballmer today in a memo.' _________________________________________ Surprisingly, this actually sounds like a good idea. Over a decade ago, Microsoft, under threat of being split up following antitrust litigation by the DOJ, effectively split itself up, in preparation for forcible dismemberment. That move was never undone, and probably remains a significant handicap. This bears watching. Will it actually improve the way Microsoft operates? Time will tell.

Topic.Title: PC sales drop 11% in second quarter

Message.Msg: in some segments ... "Google Chromebook Under $300 Defies PC Market With Growth" ::Chromebooks have in just the past eight months snagged 20 percent to 25 percent of the U.S. market for laptops that cost less than $300, according to NPD Group Inc. The devices, which have a full keyboard and get regular software updates from Google, are the fastest-growing part of the PC industry based on price, NPD said. The surge marks Chromebooks as one of the few types of computers able to attract consumers while Dell Inc. (DELL) and other traditional PC makers undergo a shakeout. The industry has already seen notebook-PC sales eroded by the popularity of smartphones and tablets such as Apple Inc. (AAPL)’s iPad. As a result of the shift, worldwide PC shipments fell 4 percent in 2012 and are forecast to decline 7.8 percent this year, the largest annual drop on record, according to researcher IDC.::

Topic.Title: WINDOW 8 , I love it !!!

Message.Msg: As an older guy long familiar with iMacs and PC's, I bought an add on "Start Classic" so I could have the Start Button "just in case". However, once I found my way with the ingenious Windows 8, I never went back to the old training wheels; in fact I could care less that the start button is there or not. It's a pacifier for older folks like me, but once anyone works with Windows 8 and learns it, they will absolutely love it. I know. I did.
